title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels all Hingham/Hull ferry services on February 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will run from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal, with service starting at 6:30 a.m.
Recent snowstorm causing over a foot of snow in Boston has led to multiple ferry cancellations this winter.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy, 60, died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
Kennedy was hit outside the McGauvran Center on February 5, later dying at Lahey Hospital from his injuries.
The incident is under investigation by the Middlesex District Attorney's Office and Massachusetts State Police.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start 2026 season in Triple-A due to health issues and crowded Red Sox infield.
Kristian Campbell faces a likely return to minors after struggling defensively and at the plate in 2025.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early might open season in Triple-A due to Boston's full rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State documents show N.H. officials knew about plans for an ICE facility in Merrimack as early as Jan. 12.
Plans for a new immigrant detention center in Merrimack have caused discord, leading to a commissioner's resignation.
The proposed facility, located at 50 Robert Milligan Parkway, is expected to cost $158 million to renovate.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell struggled in the Super Bowl, allowing 14 pressures and contributing to the Patriots' 29-13 loss.
Former Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle despite his late-season performance issues.
Terron Armstead has offered to help Campbell improve his technique during offseason workouts in Dallas.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel addressed his players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to Seattle Seahawks.
Vrabel emphasized unity and future potential, noting the Patriots' 307-day season following a significant improvement from 2024.
Despite the loss, Vrabel expressed optimism about building on the successful 2025 season with New England's young roster.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots move Terrell Williams to a senior, less taxing role after his recovery from prostate cancer.
Zak Kuhr, interim defensive play-caller, is favored to become the Patriots' full-time defensive coordinator.
Under Kuhr, Patriots' defense ranked fourth in points allowed, contributing to their Super Bowl LX success.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a Pittsfield hit-and-run, dragged extensively by a dark-colored sedan.
The incident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue; the vehicle fled the scene heading towards West Housatonic Street.
Pittsfield police are investigating and seeking public assistance to identify the driver involved in the fatal incident.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost to Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX, despite Drake Maye setting a passing yards record.
Ann Michael Maye shared an encouraging Instagram post, expressing gratitude for the Patriots' season.
Drake Maye praised his wife's online following and looks forward to spending the offseason with her.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Boston Children's Hospital.
Gallagher is part of the Miles for Miracles team, raising funds as a way to honor the care his son received.
His son, now 4, has been treated by Boston Children's neurology team, inspiring Gallagher's marathon participation.
